page.title: 09PAST MEMORIES OF SCHOOL 1
page.content: On 8 July 1985 four pupils from Longdendale School went to The Hollies, a home for elderly people. We talked to them about their schooling. Mrs Pointer told us she went to the Primary School in Hollingworth which is still used today. This was also her senior school too. School started at 8.45 am and they worked though to 12. You then went home for dinner and returned at 1.30 pm and then worked through to 4pm. The subjects taught were nothing like our lessons today. There was reading, writing and arithmetic and they said lots of prayers and sang songs. Schools were very strict then and the cane was used frquently. Mrs Pointer said she remembered being caned just for being rude to a girl who was younger than her.
